es.ucm.fdi.tp.was

Class WasState

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.ucm.fdi.tp.base.model.GameState<WasState,WasAction>
      • es.ucm.fdi.tp.was.WasState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class WasState
extends GameState<WasState,WasAction>
    A state for the game "Wolf and Sheeps" storing all the relevant information needed to keep playing.
    Version:
    1 (13/03/2017)
    Author:
    Claudia Guerrero Garc√≠a-Heras and Rafael Herrera Troca

      • moves

        private static final WasState.Coord[] moves
        Different coordinates representing how can a player move on the board. A sheep can move as the two first ones and the wolf as the four of them.

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public double evaluate(int playerNumber)
        Description copied from class: GameState
        Evaluates how close playerNumber is to winning (1) or losing (-1). A draw or game that has not started is considered neutral.
        Overrides:
        evaluate in class GameState<WasState,WasAction>
        Parameters:
        playerNumber - to evaluate for
        Returns:
        0 if the game is a draw, or not yet in play and not won, 1 (-1) if the game is a win (loss) for that player, intermediate values for other scenarios.

      • inRange

        Returns:

      • getWinner

        public int getWinner()
        Description copied from class: GameState
        returns the playerNumber of the winner, if any.
        Specified by:
        getWinner in class GameState<WasState,WasAction>
        Returns:
        -1 if no winner (not finished or draw); 0 if first player won, 1 if second player, and so on.
